attributes.action: To authorise an amended version of the 1962 proposed Altrincham and Sale bypass.
attributes.background:
The A56 carries approx. 35,000 vehicles per day with HGVs and OGVs
contributing approx. 13.5% of this figure. Resulting air pollution affects peoples health, contributing to respiratory illness, heart disease and some cancers. Noise, road accidents, traffic congestion are other associated factors
attributes.additional_details:
Starting from the M60 Carrington Spur junction with Carrington Lane, going South across Carrington Moss towards Ashton Road joining the A56 west of the new A556 bypass, giving a direct link between the M60 jnc 8 to the M56 jnc 8 and onto the M6 jnc 19 via the new A556 intersections
Linking the M60 to the A56 west will create a new circular transportation network.
STOP THIS A56 TRAFFIC NIGHTMARE -BUILD THE ALTRINCHAM AND SALE BYPASS NOW.
Please sign the petition
Please sign this petition now.

attributes.action: Give babies born from 17 -40 weeks proper Birth and a Death certificates
attributes.background: Give a proper Birth and a Death certificates to all babies born from 17-40 weeks babies taking a breath at Birth are not being give a proper birth certificate and a Death certificate because doctors are classifying them as not viable not even to give medical assistance to keep them alive
attributes.additional_details:
These certificates are significantly important to these parents it gives the parents recognition for the baby to not have them makes the parents feel their baby did not exist.
And if the baby is born and is taking a breath even if it’s only 17 weeks gestation Doctors should give the medical attention and try to save he baby’s life and not step back and say the baby is not viable

attributes.action: Use a different coloured disabled badge for people with invisible disabilities.
attributes.background: Have you ever been a victim of verbal or physical abuse whilst using your blue badge? and do you have a condition that is not visible on the outside? I think there should be another way for us to show others that there are people with disabilities that can’t be seen.

attributes.action: Make middle rate DLA a base rate for children with Cystic fibrosis.
attributes.background: Many parents caring for a child with Cystic fibrosis aren't getting carers allowance because families are being told they can only get lower rate disability living allowance, CF is a chronic illness that requires many daily treatments. Many parents cant work due to this & need carers allowance!
attributes.additional_details: Many people are awarded middle or high level for the care and mobility parts of DLA, its awarded for conditions that aren't chronic, so CF should be taken more seriously with awards. Some families on forums discuss how two families who have CF children with the same daily routines apply and one may be awarded lower rate and one higher rate. Theres no pattern at all it just depends who gets the paperwork. CF should have a minimum award rate of middle care.

attributes.action: Change marriage law in England/Wales from registered buildings to celebrants.
attributes.background: The Scots system of registered celebrants is very much simpler than the English and Welsh system of registered buildings, and it also affords greater flexibility to couples.
attributes.additional_details: Currently in England and Wales couples must choose either a religious service in a church, or a wholly secular service in secular building, where they are not allowed anything even vaguely religious including music. Under the Scots system couples can choose any venue in which a celebrant is willing to conduct a marriage service, and a religious or civil ceremony. This means that couples can choose a religious ceremony in a greater choice of venues, and administration is simpler (and probably cheaper).

attributes.action: End bedroom tax for bereaved parents/carers on the room of their deceased child
attributes.background:
Bedroom tax on the room of a deceased child is unfair, no parent wants an empty room for this reason.
My daughter passed away 2.5 years ago and I haven’t unpacked her hospital bag. I couldn’t imagine being forced to pack up her belongings and move away from the home that holds our memories.
attributes.additional_details:
Bedroom tax comes into effect a year after the child’s death, if the parent is claiming housing benefit.
A year is a short period of time after the loss of a child to then endure the stress of extra financial commitments.
Some parents may feel unable to work due overwhelming grief, PTSD or other reasons. 
Penalising them for their child’s death or making them move before they are ready will only cause more distress.
It is a cruel tax placed on people who are already suffering unimaginable pain.

attributes.action: To reform outdated English marriage law, which is no longer ‘Fit For Purpose’
attributes.background:
We need to reform the Marriage Act 1949 as it is 70 years out of date. 

Make it compulsory for every faith to register marriages, not just 3 faiths (Anglicans, Jews and Quakers). 

100,000s have no legal rights in an unregistered religious marriage and this figure is rising yearly.
attributes.additional_details:
Religious marriages conducted abroad are legally recognised, but UK religious marriages are not. The result? Chaos, injustice and discrimination:

- Overnight homelessness, destitution
- lost savings invested in ‘matrimonial’ home 
- No Pension or Inheritance rights
- Men, women and children suffer

There are no Cohabitation rights - and these couples face a double handicap as they thought they were married.

In the 21st century, a fair and equal marriage law needs to cover all faiths.

attributes.action: UK must apologise for Balfour Declaration and commit to Mideast peace efforts
attributes.background: We call on Her Majesty's government, led by Prime Minister Theresa May, to officially apologise to the Palestinian people for issuing the Balfour Declaration in 1917
attributes.additional_details: Balfour, a public statement issued by the British government during World War I announcing support for the establishment of a Jewish state in Palestine, has led to mass displacement of the Palestinian nation. November 7 2017 will mark 100 years since Balfour. https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/8/8e/Balfour_declaration_unmarked.jpg

attributes.action: Stop Southern Rail being able to increase their fares in January
attributes.background: Southern Rail have a long and well documented history of terrible service. We believe this will continue irrespective of financial investment. Given the last two years of hell commuters have endured because of their dependence on Southern, they should not be allowed to increase their fares.
attributes.additional_details: There is a myriad of websites, forums and social media pertaining to the disruption Southern have caused for commuters over the last two years. People have had to move house for work. People have lost jobs. Even now in London, companies are screening candidates based on their dependence on Southern rail. These are facts and in no other arena can a company provide such abysmal service and continue to raise prices.

attributes.action: Reduce the overseas aid to 0.2% of GNI.
attributes.background: We should reduce our overseas aid budget of 0.7% of (GNI) to 0.2% of GNI to come in-line with other European Countries and America. Based on the £12b budget of 2015 this would leave us with an additional £8b which should be immediately allocated to the NHS and social care budgets.
attributes.additional_details: We also ask that all overseas aid should be means tested before any Country is allocated any money at all. This will stop the waste of hundreds of millions that goes to Countries with space programs for example or are fighting wars with their neighbours and their own people.

attributes.action: Make Fake Social Media Profiles Illegal
attributes.background: Fake profiles are used on Facebook, Instagram, dating websites and more. These profiles are currently used to abuse, stalk, harass, shame or harm real people emotionally and in some cases physically. People use these fake identities to disguise their own so they can get away with harmful behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: If fake profiles were made illegal there would be more discouragement to make one in the first place as the repercussions would be higher. I have personally been stalked, harassed, body shamed, and received vulgar bullying messages from one individual posing as multiple. There are enough public circumstances that have lead to physical attacks, assaults and self harm. Positive action needs to be made to prevent fake profiles as this should be considered criminal fraudulent activity. Thank You

attributes.action: Stop the pothole pandemic ravaging communities through out the UK.
attributes.background: A call to increase allocation of funds to councils by the government for road care. Following the heavy snow through out the UK and lack of funds councils are already granted to care for the roads, many new potholes have emerged, old ones re-opened and previously ones left to fester and grow.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of unnecessary single use plastics in UK shops.
attributes.background: We are a Year 3 class in a school in London, We have been exploring single use plastic and it's damaging effect on oceans. After finishing our research we have decided that the government has a responsibility to limit excess use of plastics. This could be achieved by fines or tax breaks.

attributes.action: Give all British Gibraltarian citizens the right to vote and a dedicated MP
attributes.background: About 33,000 British Gibraltarian citizens living in European British Gibraltar do not have the right to vote in UK General Elections. They therefore lack representation in Parliament. Although British Gibraltarian Citizens voted in EU referendum, they are not eligible to vote in UK Gen. Elections.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that all British Gibraltarian citizens deserve genuine representation in Parliament. British Gibraltarian citizens must be able to vote for an MP to represent their interests in the House of Commons. Having their own dedicated MPs would more efficiently address their concerns which are often different to UK residents’. This petition proposes to assist British Gibraltarians express their views in Brexit negotiations and enable parliament to explicitly know their demands and concerns.

attributes.action: Outlaw the inhumane slaughter of fish in commercial and non-commercial fishing
attributes.background: Fish are by far the UK's greatest victims of animal abuse as 800,000 suffer the following fates every day. Common methods of fish slaughter are cutting/filleting alive (fish remain conscious for 25-65 more mins) and suffocation (takes 55-250 minutes of complete agony). There are humane alternatives.
attributes.additional_details:
Most reputable marine biologists, at major centers (including experts at the University of Cambridge and multiple national centres of marine life studies), now believe that fish can feel pain in as many ways that we do and that they are MUCH smarter than we previously thought. With that in mind, both non-commercial and commercial fisherman almost always use inhumane, prolonged methods of slaughter. 
Sources:  humane slaughter by fish count.org.uk.  Do Fish Feel Pain? by Jonathan Balcombe/PBS.

attributes.action: Ban unsustainable Palm Oil from being used in produce that is sold in the UK.
attributes.background: The Palm Oil industry is linked to major issues such as deforestation, habitat degradation, climate change, animal cruelty and indigenous rights abuses in the countries where it is produced, as the land and forests must be cleared for the development of the oil palm plantations.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.saynotopalmoil.com/Whats_the_issue.php

https://www.rainforest-rescue.org/topics/palm-oil

attributes.action: Investigate Southeastern’s handling of the Lewisham situation on 2/3/2018
attributes.background: On 2/3/2018 hundreds of passengers boarded the 16:35 from London Bridge to Dartford. The train in front broke down due to age (as admitted by the driver). Passengers forced to wait for 4 hours in freezing conditions and no toilet/food/heat/information. Why was this handled so badly?
attributes.additional_details: We want a full investigation into what happened and someone to be held accountable for this mess so that it is not allowed to happen again. Please immediately initiate a government inquest and find out what Southeastern started doing the moment they learned what had happened, why it took so long to initiate a rescue plan and why they were nowhere to be seen for the entire duration of the event. The concern is that this could have been so much worse and that they were just lucky this time.

attributes.action: Ensure there's a legal entitlement to contact with siblings and half-siblings
attributes.background:
Individuals should be entitled to contact with their siblings (including 'half-' and step-siblings) under 18, unless the courts deem that there is reasonable concern this would have a negative impact on the child's welfare. 
As the law currently stands, there's no rights of access for siblings.
attributes.additional_details:
The 'nuclear family model' (a father, mother and their children) is no longer representative of the family dynamics within the UK.  
Therefore, we hope a law will be put in place to ensure siblings are entitled to contact with each other, as the law does not currently serve to protect that special, intimate bond they share. If the parent with custody decided to stop access to the other parent, the siblings suffer consequently - being unable to see each other.

attributes.action: Change what DWP are allowed to take off your Benefits from 40% to maximum 20%
attributes.background: At the moment for a single adult claimant of Universal Credit the law states we can live on £317.82 but can take 40% (£127) of this to pay off likes of budget loans or rent arrears etc leaving someone with very little to live on after bills & food
attributes.additional_details:
£317.82 is for a single person over 25yr old as stated here: https://www.gov.uk/universal-credit/what-youll-get

Now for someone only on Universal Credit that £127 a month reduction can cause serious hardship. Please help us to get this amount reduced to a more manageable amount such as £31 (10%) or £63 (20) at the most.

Universal Credit as many of you are aware is the new blanket benefit for anyone whether unemployed part time worker or disabled.

attributes.action: Require a Register for Telecommunications to Publish EMF Radiation
attributes.background: EMF radiation in unsafe levels is a threat to public health and safety.  A public register for telecommunications to publish EMF radiation from mast towers or similar is paramount for public health and authorities to monitor under national and international laws.
attributes.additional_details: A public register for telecommunication mast towers EMF radiation levels is needed.  Other industries are expected under Environmental Law, Public Health and Health and Safety to operate within national and international standards and even to publish for controls, management, obligation and accountability.  Telecommunication companies have many of their mast towers in residential areas and do not publish public the EMF radiation levels past or present and a threat to public health.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of rabbits in pet shops & garden centres.
attributes.background: Rabbits are the 3rd most popular pet in the UK, yet the most neglected and abandoned. Pet shops and garden centres do not properly educate people on the appropriate care of rabbits and sell them as cheap, easy short-lived pets who live in small cages, which is very incorrect. Rabbits deserve better.
attributes.additional_details: 4 out of 5 rabbits bought as pets near Easter are abandoned or die within a year. (source: The Metro). Rabbits are the most abused domestic pet in England and Wales, with 35,000 abandoned every year. Also 70% of rescued rabbits had been kept hutched 24 hours a day. The RSPCA states that people bought rabbits but then quickly lost interest. On avg, the rabbits it came across had been dumped after just three months. (souce: RSPCA) If they are not in shops, they will not be impulse buys.

attributes.action: Stop the CUTS to our armed forces.
attributes.background: The MOD have announced that our armed forces will be cut over the next few years. If this happens it means our Navy, Army and Air Force won't be able to defend this country by conventional means, and would have to rely on our nuclear capabilities instead.

attributes.action: Increase security at unmanned train stations to prevent suicide
attributes.background: All unmanned train stations should have security gates and CCTV that captures motion. No passengers should be allowed onto the platform until the train has stopped. People getting off trains should be monitored to make sure they leave the station. This would help to prevent suicide and accidents.
attributes.additional_details: My son Oscar Phillips took his own life aged just 16, with no history or signs of any mental illness. Oscar one day took himself to our local station and never came back. A lonely unmanned station, with 80mph trains passing, but no restrictions on public access.

attributes.action: Stop Botox & Dermal fillers on minors by making it illegal for those under 18
attributes.background: Cosmetic doctors, nurses, dentists and surgeons have been calling for tougher regulations for injectables. In the UK, it’s almost entirely unregulated with no minimum age for those seeking out Botox or dermal fillers.
attributes.additional_details: Without enforcement of any laws there has been an increase in botched treatments, some of which have been very dangerous, leaving the vulnerable millennial generation at most risk.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of foie gras throughout the UK when we leave the EU
attributes.background: Foie gras production has been banned in the U.K. so it seems hypocritical to still be able to sell foie gras. Now that we're leaving the EU, we should stop selling it.

attributes.action: Provide around-the-clock care and a 24/7 helpline for traumatised troops
attributes.background:
The Mail on Sunday is campaigning to ensure our brave soldiers no longer suffer in silence.
Our 'Helpline for Heroes' campaign calls on defence chiefs to set up a 24/7 helpline staffed by mental healthcare experts. It would cost just £2million.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 1995, more than 400 serving UK troops have killed themselves while the number of personnel suffering from Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) has almost doubled since 2007 to 2,500 cases.
Yet, shockingly, the Government has cut back the provision of mental healthcare to the Armed Forces. Today, traumatised troops must rely on the NHS and charities for help outside office hours and at weekends.

attributes.action: Require teacher training about how to educate children with FASD
attributes.background: I have a child with fetal alcohol spectrum disorder (FASD) and alcohol-related neurodevelopmental disorder (ARND). Teachers need training to educate the thousands of children with this condition. So many of them are being failed because of the lack of awareness within our schools and society.
attributes.additional_details: FASD is a condition a lot of children are born with due to the consumption of alcohol in pregnancy. The condition can range from very mild to very extreme. Children with this condition find their everyday lives very hard ranging from: forming friendships; understanding emotions; having delayed speech; poor short term memory; anger issues; and finding it very hard in education. There are a few organisations out there that offer a lot of advice like NOFAS-UK which help educate people school and other professionals.

attributes.action: Make closed book GCSE English Literature OPTIONAL for 16 year olds in the UK
attributes.background:
Year 11 students face the huge task of taking a compulsory exam in GCSE English Literature. This is a closed book exam in which the study and  memorisation of quotes is essential . 
Surely this is an unnecessary waste of resources when there is already a compulsory examination in English Langauge.
attributes.additional_details:
The NSPCC reports a surge in the number of young people seeking help through the Childline support service specifically as a result of exam stress. 

We are concerned that the new style English Literature exam is inaccessible to students where poor language and literary skills prevail; its compulsory nature breeds unprecedented levels of stress.

Ministers wishing to tackle student mental health issues,  should consider the impact of their English Literature Exam policy; make it optional study .

attributes.action: Abolish the 3-month rule so that people receiving chemotherapy can obtain PIP
attributes.background: Under the 3 month rule, I don't qualify for PIP. I’m therefore living with debilitating stage 4 Cancer whilst trying to get by on SSP and donations. As cancer now affects one in two people, PIP must be made available to all patients receiving chemotherapy, as this is when we need financial support.
attributes.additional_details: Respected charities acknowledge cancer results in an immediate increase in expenses. When it’s cold, there are increased heating costs. Eating a healthy and varied diet is expensive.  Patients suffer from extreme fatigue and many have to swallow their pride by asking for help performing very basic and personal tasks.  There’s also an array of appointments to keep that result in additional transport costs. Having cancer is therefore not only frightening and degrading, it’s also expensive.

attributes.action: Place a permanent ban on the UK production and import of plastic drinking straws
attributes.background: Plastic pollution is a global issue, with plastic now being found in all oceans. Wasteful single-use items such as drinking straws are at the forefront of the problem. Every plastic straw ever made still exists in some form and they are consistently in the top ten of items found during beach cleans.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastic straws are a big part of the global problem of unnecessary items ending up in the ocean, harming wildlife and entering the food chain. Eco friendly alternatives are available and there's no excuse for not using them.

http://www.plasticpollutioncoalition.org/pft/2017/1/3/the-problem-of-plastic-straws-and-how-each-of-us-can-make-a-difference

This petition demands that the British Government put planet before profit and permanently ban the UK production and import of plastic straws.

attributes.action: Oblige employers to give paid leave for parents of kids with chronic illnesses.
attributes.background: Parents of children with chronic illnesses (e.g. juvenile idiopathic arthritis or juvenile diabetes) need time off work for frequent medical appointments, meaning parents often lose their jobs or cannot continue to work, leading to hardship.  The law should provide for permitted, paid time off.

attributes.action: Teach pupils to check themselves as part of sex education to prevent cancer
attributes.background: At 29 years old, Simone Ferman, mother of two from Essex was diagnosed with stage 3 breast cancer. The lump was discovered by her partner - Simone never checked herself as she didn't know how to. If pupils were taught this as part of sex education in schools, it could save thousands of lives.
attributes.additional_details: If you have a sore throat, you go to the doctor and get medicine. If you find a lump, you go and get it checked - Yes? Wrong! Most people don't get it checked as they don't know they have a lump and then it's too late. There are millions of men and women who don't check themselves as they don't know how. We need to raise awareness as if a lump is cancerous and caught early, there is a very high survival rate. Pupils therefore need to be taught in school, as part of sex education, how to check.

attributes.action: Make compassionate leave compulsory and paid
attributes.background: Make compassionate leave for close family members (parents, children, siblings, partners, in-laws and grandparents) compulsory for companies to recognize, and for the leave to be paid so the surviving family member is not left shortpaid due to the relatives death.
attributes.additional_details:
In May 2017, both of my grandfathers passed away. My company did not grant compassionate leave either time, giving me the only option to take it as unpaid sick leave. This pushed me into financial difficulty which I have yet to come out of, playing catch up each month. 

My cousin had the same situation, having to take annual leave on the day of our grandfathers death.

Family members dying is hard enough to deal with emotionally, the worker should not be affected financially as well.

attributes.action: Ban all trade of Ivory in the UK with NO exceptions!
attributes.background: Elephants’ biggest threat is the trade in their ivory tusks. The UK has become the world’s leading exporter in ivory in recent years. The newly proposed ban contains exceptions, including musical Instruments and items of "cultural importance". The ban should be TOTAL, with no exceptions.
attributes.additional_details: For more information search for "The Truth Behind Your Ivory Trinkets" on YouTube. This video shows the brutal process by which ivory is harvested and contains more information about the ivory trade. Please watch.

attributes.action: Stop Anti-abortion Life charity from getting £250k from from UK tampon tax.
attributes.background: The government has confirmed that it is to award a quarter of a million pounds from an unpopular levy on women’s sanitary products to an anti-abortion organisation, despite objections from women’s groups and MPs.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/oct/28/anti-abortion-life-charity-will-get--tampon-tax-funds

attributes.action: Educate children in schools regarding fellow pupils' illnesses and their effects
attributes.background:
Over the past 9 years of supporting sick and disabled children and running Matts Mission Children's Charity over 6 years, we sadly come into contact with many families with sick children that have lost hair or are disabled and are bullied in school.

A subject needs to be put in place to support.
attributes.additional_details: Children all over the world are being diagnosed with a serious illness every day, they go through so much, treatment for an illness such as cancer makes the child's hair fall out. Sadly many children in schools including higher education schools are being called names, spat on, laughed at, wigs pulled off there head. It is getting out of control, it is time these children understood the damage they are causing to the confidence of these sick children. Schools need to help to stop this happening.

attributes.action: Make it the law for children's feelings and wishes to be heard in family court
attributes.background: I want it to be the law that children can voice what they want to happen in family court, in person, by a voice recorded clip to be played or a letter to be read by the judge. Too many children are not being heard, it time to give them a voice.

attributes.action: Make every workplace and school complete a mandatory yearly CPR training day.
attributes.background: Many people don't know how to perform a life saving procedure (CPR) due to no fault of their own, but due to their school or work areas not providing this training. I believe more lives will be saved if CPR training is an mandatory training session. I know many people would appreciate this training.

attributes.action: On Armistice Day 2018, light beacons across the country as a sign of Remembrance
attributes.background:
This year marks the centenary of the end of the Great War.
As a mark of respect to all The Brave who made the ultimate sacrifice and gave their lives for their country, the Government should light Beacons across the country on Armistice Day (November 11th) 2018.

attributes.action: Abolish Mobile Speed Cameras
attributes.background: The use of mobile speed cameras is increasing generating masses of revenue for local authorities. Current tactics used to target drivers on the roads when going about their daily business is wrong, has a negative impact on lives and contributes only a small percentage to road safety.
attributes.additional_details:
These days it’s easy to speed in modern cars & the police know it so when traveling to work one day in a safe manner they’ll be waiting for you tucked in on some layby.

Law abiding citizens caught by these mobile speed traps feel they’ve been deliberately targeted & criminalised by the organisation set out to protect is in for gain. Millions of drivers fined for speeding over the years have seen nothing in return and whilst this continues what improvements have we seen from all these fines?

attributes.action: Ensure all gig economy workers get holiday pay, sick pay, and minimum wage
attributes.background: Hundreds of thousands of gig economy workers miss out on basic rights like holiday pay, sick pay and the minimum wage because of outdated legislation and employment status definitions. We urgently need reform to ensure flexible working doesn’t come at the cost of basic rights.

attributes.action: Bring HMP Service in line with other public services and improve the uniform
attributes.background: The current uniform for HM Prison service is out of date and unpractical. Staff working within prisons are required to wear neckties and white shirts when other public services like the police are not, even though they face the public on a daily basis. Polo shirts are smarter and more practical.
attributes.additional_details: The current rules regarding the uniform are fluid and are at the discretion of establishment Governors, some staff are not required to wear ties throughout the summer but must wear them for winter periods. The ties offer no protection from the cold and do not improve the working practice of staff, in fact can be described as a barrier between staff and prisoners. The money saved on producing white shirts and ties could easily be used to improve rehabilitation of offenders.

attributes.action: Increase funding for the Royal Army Chaplains' Department.
attributes.background: For centuries the Royal Army Chaplains’ Department has ministered to soldiers and their families in times of war and peace. They provide spiritual support, pastoral care, and moral guidance to all.
attributes.additional_details: The planned closure of bases will lead to fewer Garrison Churches. I believe that they provide spiritual support, moral guidance and pastoral care that is invaluable for our Royal Army and that cannot be learned in a classroom.

attributes.action: Stop Southeastern Trains (Govia) from being awarded  franchise renewal.
attributes.background:
Southeastern / Govia have bid to renew their contract from December 2018.  
Despite making a £150 million profit they offer a poor and unacceptable service to their passengers.
Transport Secretary needs to be aware of how bad the service provided by Southeastern is.
attributes.additional_details:
- Daily repetitive train delays
- Unfair practice to stop delay repay
- Difficulty in applying for delay repay
- Short formed trains daily 
- Lack of working and clean toilets 
- % of cancelled trains daily 
- Lack of communication to passengers for delayed trains 
- Conflicting information to passengers 
- The Lewisham stranded train fiasco
- Increasing costs for a service which is decreasing and not acceptable for what passengers / commuters pay

attributes.action: Create a bank holiday to celebrate the marriage of Prince Harry & Meghan Markle
attributes.background: Today a spokesperson for the Prime Minister stated there was no intention of holding a bank holiday. People should be allowed to rejoice in the marriage of Prince Harry & Meghan Markle. There is precedent for this. A bank holiday was granted for the marriage of The Duke & Duchess of Cambridge.

attributes.action: Raise the voting age to 21
attributes.background: I feel as everything else is going up like smoking/drinking and this shouldn't be any different also it would reduce voting fraud.

attributes.action: To not spend £50m of public money on a memorial to the Holocaust
attributes.background:
Why are we spending £50m of public money on a memorial to the Holocaust? Great Britain didn't carry out this atrocity but spent years fighting at war because of it. 
Surely this is tribute enough? 
Spend our money on more pressing matters at home , e.g.  NHS etc.

attributes.action: Halt Taunton Deane District Council taking over West Somerset District Council.
attributes.background: The obliteration of West Somerset Council will reduce electoral its representation, will centralise services in the more prosperous and more urbanised Taunton Deane and distance people in West Somerset from the delivery of services by making those delivering the services less accountable.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed merger was based on a deficit accumulated by West Somerset. The deficit, that is forecast to drop dramatically, is not surprising given West Somerset's relative deprivation and the unfair distribution of the rural grant that pays a city like Bristol more per head in than the deeply rural and under populated West Somerset.

Construction of Hinkley C nuclear power station and the government's policy of local councils retaining business rates will change the fortunes of West Somerset.

attributes.action: Encourage British Sign Language in KS1 in Schools
attributes.background:
Being a child of Deaf  Parents I am deeply passionate about having Sign Language involved in Schools.
With a population of 11 million Chilren Deaf or Hearing impaired in our Country I feel it would be of huge benefit to teach Sign language at a young age..
attributes.additional_details:
With alot of deaf Schools closing and Deaf Hearing impaired Children now being taught in mainsteam Schools with Classroom support.
Socially they are being affected..
Its a lonely place for Deaf Children Socially.
With a huge shortage of interpreters and some Deaf adults having to wait almost a week for support. I feel Children will enjoy sign language enough to encourage them to feel as passionate as myself and gain qualifications.
Lets make a bridge bring hearing and deaf together.

attributes.action: Ban processed meat adverts in the UK
attributes.background: Processed meat has been classified as carcinogenic to humans by the WHO. As little as one serving a day increases the risk of diabetes by 50% and heart disease by 42% (guardian) and causes 8,500 cancers every year. Advertisements of it should be banned completely.
attributes.additional_details:
Processed meat was now in a group of 120 proven carcinogens, alongside alcohol, asbestos and tobacco.
The WHO advised that consuming 50g of processed meat a day – equivalent to just a couple of rashers of bacon or one hotdog – would raise the risk of getting bowel cancer by 18% over a lifetime. The consumption of processed meat causes an additional 34,000 worldwide cancer deaths a year,  four times the number of people killed annually on Britain’s roads.
Consuming just 9g of bacon a day – less than a rasher – could significantly raise the risk of developing breast cancer later in life. Jill Pell from Glasgow University says that “it would be misleading” for health authorities to set any safe dose for processed meat “other than zero”. The Guardian.
